name: Estate Pinot Noir
tasting_notes: Cherry, raspberry, subtle oak, silky tannins.
winemaker_notes: From our oldest hillside blocks, hand-picked and gently pressed.
terroir: Volcanic soils, cool nights, low-yield vines.
vinification: 10 months in French oak (20% new), native ferment.
food_pairings: Roast duck, mushroom risotto, grilled salmon.
story: Named for the family’s first vineyard planted in the 1980s.
